Class BoardLocation

java.lang.Object
  BoardLocation

public class BoardLocation
extends java.lang.Object

This class can store a chess board location. It also includes methods for converting character representations of locations to integer representations

Version:
$Id: BoardLocation.java,v 1.4 2002/04/19 16:03:17 mtjspaan Exp $
Author:
Nikos Massios, Matthijs Spaan

Field Summary
 int column
          stores the column of the chess board location (range 0-7)

          stores the row of the chess board location (range 0-7)

          Constructor.

          Converts a character representing a chess board column to an integer.

Field Detail

row

public int row
stores the row of the chess board location (range 0-7)

public int column
stores the column of the chess board location (range 0-7)

Constructor Detail

BoardLocation

public BoardLocation(java.lang.String loc)
Constructor. It uses its argument to initialise class fields row and column.

Parameters:
loc - The chess board location represented as a string. For example, "e2"
See Also:
row, column

BoardLocation

public BoardLocation(int column,
                     int row)
Constructor. It uses its arguments to initialise class fields row and column.

Parameters:
column - The column of the chess board location. For example, "e" is mapped 4.
row - The row of the chess board location. For example, "5" is mapped 4.
See Also:
row, column
Method Detail

getRow

public int getRow(char row)
Converts a character representing a chess board row to an integer. For example character '3' is converted to integer 2.

Parameters:
row - The chess board row as a character (range '1'-'8').
Returns:
The chess board row as an integer (range 0-7).

getCol

public int getCol(char column)
Converts a character representing a chess board column to an integer. For example characters 'b' or 'B' are converted to integer 1.

Parameters:
column - The chess board column as a character (range 'A'-'H' and 'a'-'h').
Returns:
The chess board column as an integer (range 0-7).
